name: Country Music's Steve Wariner Quiz | Music | 15 Questions

questions.text: What is Steve Wariner's middle name?
questions.explanation:
Noel.

	Being a Christmas baby, he had to have an appropriate middle name.

December 25th.

	Born on Christmas Day in 1954 in Indiana.

questions.text: Whose band did Steve Wariner join when he was 17?
questions.explanation:
Dottie West's.

	At age 10, he joined a group fronted by his father.

questions.text: What was his first hit single?
Today Steve Wariner is considered a good songwriter, but early in his career he mostly recorded songs written by others. What is his first hit that he was a co-writer on?
Which song contains the following lyrics: 'You can be my Wonder Woman. I'll just be your Spider Man.'?
questions.explanation:
Lynda.

	The song was written about Lynda Carter who played Wonder Woman on TV.

questions.text: Which Sitcom did Steve Wariner sing the theme song for?
questions.explanation:
Who's the Boss.

	Yes, that is Steve singing 'Brand New Life'.

questions.text: Finish the title: Lonely Woman Make Good ____________.
In which category did he win his first Grammy in?
questions.explanation:
Best Country Vocal Collaboration.

	It was for the song 'Restless' which can be found on an album by Mark O'Connor. He shared this award with Mark O'Connor, Vince Gill and Ricky Skaggs.

questions.text: What was the name of his 'Instrumental Album'?
questions.explanation:
No More Mr. Nice Guy

	If you like mellow guitar instrumentals, you need to check out this album.

questions.text: Which artist did he record the song 'What If I Said' with?
Which of his songs won the Country Music Association's Song and Single of the Year?
questions.correct: Holes in the Floor of Heaven
questions.explanation: Holes in the Floor of Heaven.

questions.text: Which of the follow songs did Steve write for someone else?
questions.correct: Nothing but the Taillights by Clint Black
options: Kiss Me in the Car by John Berry
questions.explanation: Nothing but the Taillights by Clint Black.

questions.text: Which of Steve Wariner's recent singles did he actually write when he was 18?
options: Holes in the Floor of Heaven

questions.text: Finish the Lyric with a day of the week: 'The Place is hot, it's ________ night and we're burning the roadhouse down'?
questions.explanation:
Saturday.

	From the song, Burning the Roadhouse Down.
